meanings.definition: To take as a husband or wife
meanings.sent2: They decided to marry after many years of dating.
meanings.sent3: The cake and ice cream decided to marry in the bowl.
meanings.sent4: The sun and the horizon marry at sunset every evening.
meanings.sent5: The two puzzle pieces marry perfectly together.

meanings.sent1: The priest will marry the couple in the church.
meanings.sent2: The judge married them in a simple ceremony.
meanings.sent3: The magician tried to marry a rabbit and a hat during the show.
meanings.sent4: The conductor married the notes into a beautiful symphony.
meanings.sent5: The chef will marry the flavors to create a delicious dish.

meanings.sent1: The two countries decided to marry their resources for a common goal.
meanings.sent2: The flavors of the dish marry together perfectly.
